summary:
Dermatitis is a skin condition causing inflammation, itchiness, redness, and rashes. It can appear as small blisters or thickened skin, depending on its duration. The term 'eczema' is often used interchangeably with dermatitis, especially for the common type, atopic dermatitis.

Allergies, irritants, or poor blood flow might cause it. Prevention and treatment include using moisturizers, essential fatty acids, and steroid creams. Antibiotics may be needed for infections. Avoiding allergens and irritants helps with contact dermatitis. Approximately 3.34% of the global population is affected by dermatitis.
title: Dermatitis
